intro: Bauerella, commonly known as the fairy fanflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and their flowers are usually arranged in clusters. Bauerella species are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
